result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylann R. Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylann R. Hayes

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:38 p.m. Defendant Dylann R. Hayes in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, $180 drug buy money w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.  Appeal rights given.
Final pre-trial on June 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case Called @ 2:57 PM: Defendant Dylann R. Hayes in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Belville requests add'l 30 days for P/S.  ADA requests at the very least the scheduling of a FPT - the case is expected to resolve however.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Amanda Belville in court, appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Case called @ 2:33 p.m. Defendant Dylann R. Hayes in court with attorney Amanda Belville.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Recess for the defendant to speak with Atty Belville.  Case recalled @ 2:37 p.m. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:50 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-12-2015 02:45 pm

11:12 am case called. Defendant Dylann R. Hayes in court with attorney Amanda Belville.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty. Attorney Belville regarding competence and authorizations. Attorney Belville requests adjournment based on concerns. Court finds good cause to adjourn initial appearance and makes statement regarding adjournment.  INIT Scheduled - NOH Given.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:20 PM: Defendant Dylann R. Hayes in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and requests SPD appointment.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  Court would be willing to appoint counsel if found not eligible with a $250 deposit paid and a $50 per mo PP to commence on 9/1/2015.  ADA argues for $2500 Signature Bond.  No statement as to bond - Def agrees.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
